TEXT.English: Please support [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and its people. We depend on your help!
TEXT.French: Veuillez soutenir le [OUR_CIV_SHORT] et son peuple. Nous avons besoin de votre aide !
TEXT.German: Please support [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and it's people. We depend on your help!
TEXT.Italian: Please support [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and it's people. We depend on your help!
TEXT.Spanish: Please support [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and it's people. We depend on your help!

TEXT.English: This will be of mutual benefit for us both, don't you think so?
TEXT.French: Ceci nous bénéficiera mutuellement, ne croyez-vous pas ?
TEXT.German: This will be of mutual benefit for us both, don't you think so?
TEXT.Italian: This will be of mutual benefit for us both, don't you think so?
TEXT.Spanish: This will be of mutual benefit for us both, don't you think so?

TEXT.English: Our armies are evenly matched, but I believe in a battle I would win out. So that this does not occur I ask you to meet our demands.
TEXT.French: Nos armées sont de force égale, mais je crois que je gagnerais en cas de bataille. Afin que cela ne se produise pas, je vous demande de satisfaire nos exigences.
TEXT.German: Helfen hei?t br?derlich teilen, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: Se ci tieni a me, condividi, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: Compartir es de generosos, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] needs this and demands your assistance!
TEXT.French: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] a besoin de ceci et demande votre aide !
TEXT.German: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] needs this and demands your assistance!
TEXT.Italian: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] needs this and demands your assistance!
TEXT.Spanish: [OUR_CIV_SHORT] needs this and demands your assistance!

TEXT.English: Brazil is strong in many ways, [CT_NAME]. Do not force me to show you how strong.
TEXT.French: Le Brésil est fort, [CT_NAME]. Ne me poussez pas à vous montrer à quel point.
TEXT.German: Brazil is strong in many ways, [CT_NAME]. Do not force me to show you how strong.
TEXT.Italian: Brazil is strong in many ways, [CT_NAME]. Do not force me to show you how strong.
TEXT.Spanish: Brazil is strong in many ways, [CT_NAME]. Do not force me to show you how strong.

TEXT.English: You are outgunned and outclassed. I suggest you give me what I demand.
TEXT.French: Vous avez moins d'équipement que nous. Vous êtes surclassé. Je suggère que vous me donniez ce que je veux.
TEXT.German: Schlagt ein, wenn Ihr kein zweites Gettysburg erleben wollt!
TEXT.Italian: Dammi ci? che chiedo o proverai l'ira della nostra "terribile e rapida spada."
TEXT.Spanish: Dadnos esto o sentir?is la c?lera de nuestra "terrible y veloz espada".

TEXT.English: Can you spare this for the people of the [OUR_EMPIRE]?
TEXT.French: Pourriez-vous fournir ceci au peuple du [OUR_EMPIRE] ?
TEXT.German: Can you spare this for the people of the [OUR_EMPIRE]?
TEXT.Italian: Can you spare this for the people of the [OUR_EMPIRE]?
TEXT.Spanish: Can you spare this for the people of the [OUR_EMPIRE]?

TEXT.English: My people have faith in me, [CT_NAME]. Please help me not to disappoint them.
TEXT.French: Mon peuple a foi en moi, [CT_NAME]. Aidez-moi à ne pas le décevoir.
TEXT.German: My people have faith in me, [CT_NAME]. Please help me not to disappoint them.
TEXT.Italian: My people have faith in me, [CT_NAME]. Please help me not to disappoint them.
TEXT.Spanish: My people have faith in me, [CT_NAME]. Please help me not to disappoint them.

TEXT.English: The simplest strategy is for me to ask you for what we need and hope your good will wins out.
TEXT.French: La stratégie la plus simple pour moi est de vous demander de nous fournir ce dont nous avons besoin et espérer de la bonne volonté de votre part.
TEXT.German: Ihr werdet einem treuen Freund diese kleine Bitte doch nicht abschlagen, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Italian: Avresti un po' di questi in nome della nostra amicizia, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Podr?ais darles esto a unos buenos amigos, [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! I am [OUR_NAME], leader of the great civilization of [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.French: Salutations, [CT_NAME]! Je suis [OUR_NAME], souverain de la grande civilisation de [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt, [CT_NAME]! Ich bin [OUR_NAME], Anführer der großen Zivilisation von [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! I am [OUR_NAME], leader of the great civilization of [OUR_CIV_SHORT].
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! I am [OUR_NAME], leader of the great civilization of [OUR_CIV_SHORT].

TEXT.English: Hola. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. I am convinced that the good intentions of a ruler are simply not enough and that the collective factor represented by the workers is indispensable. Don't you agree [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.French: Hola. Je suis [OUR_NAME] du [OUR_EMPIRE]. Je suis convaincu que les bonnes intentions d'un souverain ne sont pas suffisantes et que le facteur collectif représenté par les travailleurs est indispensable. N'êtes-vous pas d'accord, [CT_NAME] ?
TEXT.German: Hola. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. I am convinced that the good intentions of a ruler are simply not enough and that the collective factor represented by the workers is indispensable. Don't you agree [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Italian: Hola. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. I am convinced that the good intentions of a ruler are simply not enough and that the collective factor represented by the workers is indispensable. Don't you agree [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: Hola. I am [OUR_NAME] of the [OUR_EMPIRE]. I am convinced that the good intentions of a ruler are simply not enough and that the collective factor represented by the workers is indispensable. Don't you agree [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. My name is [OUR_NAME], and I am the president of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. My motto is: when there is respect, there is peace!
TEXT.French: Salutations, [CT_NAME]. Je m'appelle [OUR_NAME], et je suis président du [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Ma devise est la suivante : là où règne le respect règne la paix !
TEXT.German: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. My name is [OUR_NAME], and I am the president of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. My motto is: when there is respect, there is peace!
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. My name is [OUR_NAME], and I am the president of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. My motto is: when there is respect, there is peace!
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. My name is [OUR_NAME], and I am the president of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. My motto is: when there is respect, there is peace!

TEXT.English: Greetings. I am [OUR_NAME], Emperor of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Dedicating all my efforts to the well-being of my people, I shall guard the concept of Autocracy like all my forefathers did.
TEXT.French: Bonjour. Je suis [OUR_NAME], empereur de [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Et dédiant tous mes efforts au bien-être de mon peuple, je défendrai l'idée de l'autocratie comme l'ont fait tous mes ancêtres.
TEXT.German: Grüße. Ich bin [OUR_NAME], Kaiser von [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Während ich all meine Anstrengungen dem Wohlergehen meines Volkes widme, werde ich das Konzept der Autokratie beschützen wie alle meine Vorväter.
TEXT.Italian: Greetings. I am [OUR_NAME], Emperor of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Dedicating all my efforts to the well-being of my people, I shall guard the concept of Autocracy like all my forefathers did.
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings. I am [OUR_NAME], Emperor of [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Dedicating all my efforts to the well-being of my people, I shall guard the concept of Autocracy like all my forefathers did.

TEXT.English: Welcome to humble [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. I am [OUR_NAME], leader of this far-reaching and ever progressing country. Tell me, who are you?
TEXT.French: Bienvenue dans l'humble [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. Je suis [OUR_NAME], souverain de ce grand pays en progrès constant. Dites-moi, qui êtes-vous ?
TEXT.German: Welcome to humble [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. I am [OUR_NAME], leader of this far-reaching and ever progressing country. Tell me, who are you?
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to humble [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. I am [OUR_NAME], leader of this far-reaching and ever progressing country. Tell me, who are you?
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to humble [OUR_CIV_SHORT]. I am [OUR_NAME], leader of this far-reaching and ever progressing country. Tell me, who are you?

TEXT.English: Hello, friend. My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Jose. Or you can call me Francisco. Or you can call me Martin. Just don't call me late for dinner.
TEXT.French: Bonjour, cher ami. Je m'appelle [OUR_NAME], mais vous pouvez m'appeler José. Ou Francisco. Ou Martín. Mais ne m'appelez pas en retard pour dîner.
TEXT.German: Hello, friend. My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Jose. Or you can call me Francisco. Or you can call me Martin. Just don't call me late for dinner.
TEXT.Italian: Hello, friend. My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Jose. Or you can call me Francisco. Or you can call me Martin. Just don't call me late for dinner.
TEXT.Spanish: Hello, friend. My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Jose. Or you can call me Francisco. Or you can call me Martin. Just don't call me late for dinner.

TEXT.English: Hello, [CT_NAME]. I am General Santa Anna, Savior of Mexico! What have you come to offer me in tribute?
TEXT.French: Bonjour, [CT_NAME]. Je suis le général Santa Anna, sauveur du Mexique ! Que venez-vous m'offrir en tribut ?
TEXT.German: Hello, [CT_NAME]. I am General Santa Anna, Savior of Mexico! What have you come to offer me in tribute?
TEXT.Italian: Hello, [CT_NAME]. I am General Santa Anna, Savior of Mexico! What have you come to offer me in tribute?
TEXT.Spanish: Hello, [CT_NAME]. I am General Santa Anna, Savior of Mexico! What have you come to offer me in tribute?

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! It is so great to be at peace with you glorious nation!
TEXT.French: Salutations, [CT_NAME] ! Qu'il est bon d'être en paix avec votre glorieuse nation !
TEXT.German: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! It is so great to be at peace with you glorious nation!
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! It is so great to be at peace with you glorious nation!
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! It is so great to be at peace with you glorious nation!

TEXT.English: I see you have come to visit, [CT_NAME]. Tell me what is it you wish to discuss.
TEXT.French: Je constate que vous êtes venu nous visiter, [CT_NAME]. Dites-moi de quoi vous voulez discuter.
TEXT.German: I see you have come to visit, [CT_NAME]. Tell me, what is it you wish to discuss.
TEXT.Italian: I see you have come to visit, [CT_NAME]. Tell me, what is it you wish to discuss.
TEXT.Spanish: I see you have come to visit, [CT_NAME]. Tell me, what is it you wish to discuss.

TEXT.English: Finally I get to talk to a worthy adversary. What can the [OUR_EMPIRE] do for you?
TEXT.French: Enfin, je parle à un adversaire digne de ce nom. Qu'est-ce que la [OUR_EMPIRE] peut faire pour vous ?
TEXT.German: Seid gegr??t, [CT_NAME]. Nehmt Platz und lasst uns ein wenig plaudern.
TEXT.Italian: Salve, [CT_NAME]. Siediti e parliamo per un po'.
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos, [CT_NAME]. Sentaos y charlemos un rato.

TEXT.English: Oh, you again... What are you going to complain about?
TEXT.French: Oh, encore vous... De quoi êtes-vous venu vous plaindre ?
TEXT.German: Oh, you again... What are you going to complain about?
TEXT.Italian: Oh, you again... What are you going to complain about?
TEXT.Spanish: Oh, you again... What are you going to complain about?

TEXT.English: Treachery, cowardice and lies are everywhere - and your nation is no exception.
TEXT.French: La traîtrise, la lâcheté et les mensonges sont partout - et votre nation ne fait pas exception.
TEXT.German: Verrat, Feigheit und Lügen sind überall - und Eure Nation ist keine Ausnahme.
TEXT.Italian: Treachery, cowardice and lies are everywhere - and your nation is no exception.
TEXT.Spanish: Treachery, cowardice and lies are everywhere - and your nation is no exception.

TEXT.English: Speak fast [CT_CIV_ADJ]. I have enough on my schedule already.
TEXT.French: Parlez vite, [CT_CIV_ADJ]. Mon horaire est déjà assez rempli.
TEXT.German: Speak fast [CT_CIV_ADJ]. I have enough on my schedule already.
TEXT.Italian: Speak fast [CT_CIV_ADJ]. I have enough on my schedule already.
TEXT.Spanish: Speak fast [CT_CIV_ADJ]. I have enough on my schedule already.

TEXT.English: You lack the guile to trick me. Be warned I will not react well to deceit.
TEXT.French: Vous n'êtes pas assez rusé pour me tromper. Soyez averti que je ne réagirai pas favorablement si vous essayez.
TEXT.German: Was verschafft mir die zweifelhafte Ehre Eures Besuchs?
TEXT.Italian: E a cosa devo il dubbio onore della tua presenza?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Y a qu? debemos el dudoso honor de vuestra compa??a?

TEXT.English: The government of the [OUR_EMPIRE] will fulfill its duty to defend its independence and to repel foreign aggression, and accept the struggle to which it has been provoked!
TEXT.French: Le gouvernement du [OUR_EMPIRE] accomplira son devoir de défendre son indépendance et de repousser toute agression, et accepte de lutter en réponse à la provocation !
TEXT.German: The government of the [OUR_EMPIRE] will fulfill its duty to defend its independence, to repel foreign aggression, and accept the struggle to which it has been provoked!
TEXT.Italian: The government of the [OUR_EMPIRE] will fulfill its duty to defend its independence, to repel foreign aggression, and accept the struggle to which it has been provoked!
TEXT.Spanish: The government of the [OUR_EMPIRE] will fulfill its duty to defend its independence, to repel foreign aggression, and accept the struggle to which it has been provoked!

TEXT.English: No way! I shall punish you for your crimes against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and its people!
TEXT.French: Jamais ! Je vous punirai pour vos crimes contre le [OUR_CIV_SHORT] et son peuple !
TEXT.German: No way! I shall punish you for your crimes against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and its people!
TEXT.Italian: No way! I shall punish you for your crimes against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and its people!
TEXT.Spanish: No way! I shall punish you for your crimes against [OUR_CIV_SHORT] and its people!

TEXT.English: I knew you would beg for peace eventually, but there will be no peace until you surrender.
TEXT.French: Je savais que vous finiriez par nous supplier de faire la paix, mais il n'y aura pas de paix avant votre reddition.
TEXT.German: Wie ein Freund von mir zu sagen pflegte: 'Ich akzeptiere nur die sofortige und bedingungslose Kapitulation'. ?u?erst treffend, nicht wahr?
TEXT.Italian: Come disse una volta un mio amico: "L'unica cosa accettabile ? una resa incondizionata e immediata." Conciso, non trovi?
TEXT.Spanish: Como un amigo m?o dijo una vez: "Ninguna condici?n es aceptable, salvo una rendici?n incondicional e inmediata". Es una l?stima, ¿no cre?is?

TEXT.English: Get out of my office!
TEXT.French: Sortez de mon bureau !
TEXT.German: Get out of my office!
TEXT.Italian: Get out of my office!
TEXT.Spanish: Get out of my office!

TEXT.English: You make me sad, [CT_NAME]. Go away.
TEXT.French: Vous m'attristez, [CT_NAME]. Partez.
TEXT.German: You make me sad, [CT_NAME]. Go away.
TEXT.Italian: You make me sad, [CT_NAME]. Go away.
TEXT.Spanish: You make me sad, [CT_NAME]. Go away.

TEXT.English: I will now use my cunning knowledge of tactics to ignore you.
TEXT.French: Permettez-moi d'user de mes grandes compétences tactiques afin de vous ignorer.
TEXT.German: Fahrt zur H?lle!
TEXT.Italian: Sparisci.
TEXT.Spanish: Pod?is iros al cuerno.

TEXT.English: Your words are but the grunts of a diseased pig, [CT_NAME]. I do not hear them.
TEXT.French: Vos paroles sonnent à mes oreilles tels les horribles grognements d'un porc agonisant, [CT_NAME]. Je ne les écouterai pas plus longtemps.
TEXT.German: Ihr sprecht mit gespaltener Zunge, [CT_NAME], und ich will es nicht hören!
TEXT.Italian: Le tue parole risuonano come i grugniti di un maiale morente, [CT_NAME]. Un rumore fastidioso che non voglio udire.
TEXT.Spanish: Vuestras palabras no son más que gruñidos de un cerdo enfermo, [CT_NAME]. Como tales, no las escucho.

TEXT.English: Give me this, [CT_NAME] and perhaps our two nations can live in peace for a while longer.
TEXT.French: Donnez-moi ce que je demande, [CT_NAME], et peut-être nos deux nations pourront-elles cohabiter en paix quelque temps encore.
TEXT.German: Gebt uns, was wir verlangen, [CT_NAME], dann besteht die Chance, dass unsere Zivilisationen noch eine Weile in Frieden miteinander leben!
TEXT.Italian: Dammi questo, [CT_NAME], e forse le nostre due nazioni vivranno in pace per un altro po'.
TEXT.Spanish: Dadme esto, [CT_NAME], y es posible que nuestras naciones puedan vivir en paz un poco más.

TEXT.English: Hand this over, [CT_NAME], and I might let you continue to exist for a short while longer.
TEXT.French: Donnez-nous ce tribut, [CT_NAME], et il est possible que je vous laisse vivre... quelque temps, en tout cas.
TEXT.German: Her damit, [CT_NAME]! Dann werde ich Euch vielleicht noch eine Weile verschonen!
TEXT.Italian: Dammelo, [CT_NAME], e potrei lasciarti continuare a esistere ancora un po'.
TEXT.Spanish: Entregadnos esto, [CT_NAME] y puede que os deje perdurar un poco más.

TEXT.English: Unlikely as it may seem, it appears that your puny civilization has something that we want. I suggest you hand it over quickly.
TEXT.French: Aussi ahurissant que cela puisse paraître, il semblerait que votre ridicule petite civilisation dispose de quelque chose qui pourrait nous être utile. Je vous suggère de nous le délivrer au plus vite.
TEXT.German: So unglaublich es auch klingen mag: Eure mickrige Zivilisation scheint tatsächlich etwas zu haben, was wir wollen. Ihr wärt gut beraten, es uns schnellstens zu überlassen!
TEXT.Italian: Per quanto possa apparire improbabile, a quanto pare la tua insignificante civiltà possiede qualcosa che vogliamo. Ti consiglio di darcelo subito.
TEXT.Spanish: Por extraño que suene, parece que vuestra civilización tiene algo que queremos. Os sugiero que nos lo deis rápidamente.

TEXT.English: Welcome, [CT_NAME]. And how is that undefended civilization of yours coming along?
TEXT.French: Bienvenue, [CT_NAME]. Alors, comment évolue donc la situation dans votre petite civilisation si vulnérable ?
TEXT.German: Willkommen, [CT_NAME]! Und, wie stehen die Dinge in Eurer hilflosen kleinen Zivilisation?
TEXT.Italian: Salve, [CT_NAME]. Come vanno le cose per la tua civiltà indifesa?
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos, [CT_NAME]. ¿Cómo está esa civilización indefensa de la que venís?

TEXT.English: Not a chance. The mighty [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people do not care to make peace with cattle-stealing brigands like you.
TEXT.French: N'y comptez pas ! Le puissant peuple des [OUR_CIV_ADJ] ne souhaite pas faire la paix avec des vils voleurs de bétail de votre espèce.
TEXT.German: Keine Chance! Das mächtige [OUR_CIV_ADJ:3] Volk hat kein Interesse daran, mit miesen Viehdieben wie Euch Frieden zu schließen!
TEXT.Italian: Neanche per idea. Al potente sovrano [OUR_CIV_ADJ] non può interessare la pace con briganti ladri di bestiame come voi.
TEXT.Spanish: Ni en broma. El poderoso pueblo [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] no se molesta ni en hacer las paces con cuatreros bergantes como vosotros.

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! The [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people always enjoy meeting vulnerable and undefended new civilizations!
TEXT.French: Mes hommages, [CT_NAME] ! Le peuple des [OUR_CIV_ADJ] est toujours enchanté de rencontrer de nouvelles civilisations vulnérables et sans défense !
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt, [CT_NAME]! Das [OUR_CIV_ADJ:3] Volk ist stets hoch erfreut, die Bekanntschaft schutz- und wehrloser neuer Zivilisationen zu machen!
TEXT.Italian: Salve, [CT_NAME]! Il sovrano [OUR_CIV_ADJ] è sempre lieto di incontrare nuove civiltà vulnerabili e indifese!
TEXT.Spanish: Â¡Saludos, [CT_NAME]! El pueblo [OUR_CIV_ADJ:1] siempre se congratula de encontrarse con civilizaciones vulnerables e indefensas.

TEXT.English: So you have emerged from your fetid country and come to me, [CT_NAME]. To what do I owe this extremely dubious honor?
TEXT.French: Vous avez enfin réussi à sortir de cet horrible pays pour venir me voir, [CT_NAME]. Que me vaut un pareil honneur ?
TEXT.German: Oha, Ihr habt Euer stinkendes Land verlassen, um mich zu besuchen, [CT_NAME]? Was verschafft mir denn diese zweifelhafte Ehre?
TEXT.Italian: E così hai lasciato quel tuo fetido paese e sei venuto da me, [CT_NAME]. E a cosa devo questo dubbio onore?
TEXT.Spanish: Así que habéis salido de vuestro fétido país y habéis venido a verme, [CT_NAME]. ¿A qué debo tan dudoso honor?

TEXT.English: A Mutual Protection Pact - Each Party Agrees to Automatically Declare War if the Other Party is Attacked.
TEXT.French: Pacte d'assistance mutuelle : chaque partie accepte de déclarer automatiquement la guerre si l'autre est attaquée.
TEXT.German: Ein Verteidigungsbündnis - Beide Parteien stimmen zu, den Angreifern der anderen Partei automatisch den Krieg zu erklären.
TEXT.Italian: Un patto di protezione reciproca: ogni civiltà accetta di dichiarare automaticamente guerra se la civiltà alleata viene attaccata.
TEXT.Spanish: Un acuerdo de protección mutua: cada parte accede a declarar automáticamente la guerra si alguien ataca a la otra.

TEXT.English: Slave Trade
TEXT.French: Commerce des esclaves
TEXT.German: Sklavenhandel
TEXT.Italian: Slave Trade
TEXT.Spanish: Slave Trade

TEXT.English: Good day and bonjour to you, [CT_NAME]. The [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people wish for peace, but insists that masters in our own house we must be.
TEXT.French: Bonjour et good day, [CT_NAME]. Le peuple [OUR_CIV_ADJ] souhaite la paix, mais nous insistons pour être maîtres chez nous.
TEXT.German: Good day and bonjour, to you [CT_NAME]. The [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people wish for peace, but insist that masters in our own house we must be.
TEXT.Italian: Good day and bonjour, to you [CT_NAME]. The [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people wish for peace, but insist that masters in our own house we must be.
TEXT.Spanish: Good day and bonjour, to you [CT_NAME]. The [OUR_CIV_ADJ] people wish for peace, but insist that masters in our own house we must be.

TEXT.English: "You sacked one of our cities!"
TEXT.French: "Vous avez saccagé l'une de nos villes !"
TEXT.German: "Ihr habt eine unserer Städte geplündert!"
TEXT.Italian: "Hai saccheggiato una delle nostre città!"
TEXT.Spanish: "¡Saqueasteis una de nuestras ciudades!"

TEXT.English: Well? I have larger matters to attend to than the envoys of petty nations. Get on with it!
TEXT.French: Well? I have larger matters to attend to than the envoys of petty nations. Get on with it!
TEXT.German: Well? I have larger matters to attend to than the envoys of petty nations. Get on with it!
TEXT.Italian: Well? I have larger matters to attend to than the envoys of petty nations. Get on with it!
TEXT.Spanish: Well? I have larger matters to attend to than the envoys of petty nations. Get on with it!

TEXT.English: A man, a plan... A man, a plan, a waterway? No, no... A man, a pla- OH! I didn't see you there. Well met, [CT_NAME]! My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Teddy.
TEXT.French: A man, a plan... A man, a plan, a waterway? No, no... A man, a pla- OH! I didn't see you there. Well met, [CT_NAME]! My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Teddy.
TEXT.German: A man, a plan... A man, a plan, a waterway? No, no... A man, a pla- OH! I didn't see you there. Well met, [CT_NAME]! My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Teddy.
TEXT.Italian: A man, a plan... A man, a plan, a waterway? No, no... A man, a pla- OH! I didn't see you there. Well met, [CT_NAME]! My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Teddy.
TEXT.Spanish: A man, a plan... A man, a plan, a waterway? No, no... A man, a pla- OH! I didn't see you there. Well met, [CT_NAME]! My name is [OUR_NAME], but you can call me Teddy.

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. I AM a jelly donut.
TEXT.French: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. I AM a jelly donut.
TEXT.German: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. I AM a jelly donut.
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. I AM a jelly donut.
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, [CT_NAME]. I AM a jelly donut.

TEXT.English: Howdy y'all, name's [OUR_NAME]. How would you like to witness a full nuclear arsenal of 400 LGM-30G Minuteman III Intercontinental Ballistic Missiles barrelling down on your sorry nation? I thought not.
TEXT.French: Howdy y'all, name's [OUR_NAME]. How would you like to witness a full nuclear arsenal of 400 LGM-30G Minuteman III Intercontinental Ballistic Missiles barrelling down on your sorry nation? I thought not.
TEXT.German: Howdy y'all, name's [OUR_NAME]. How would you like to witness a full nuclear arsenal of 400 LGM-30G Minuteman III Intercontinental Ballistic Missiles barrelling down on your sorry nation? I thought not.
TEXT.Italian: Howdy y'all, name's [OUR_NAME]. How would you like to witness a full nuclear arsenal of 400 LGM-30G Minuteman III Intercontinental Ballistic Missiles barrelling down on your sorry nation? I thought not.
TEXT.Spanish: Howdy y'all, name's [OUR_NAME]. How would you like to witness a full nuclear arsenal of 400 LGM-30G Minuteman III Intercontinental Ballistic Missiles barrelling down on your sorry nation? I thought not.

TEXT.English: Why can't I just eat my waffle? [ICON_HAPPY] xoxo
TEXT.French: Why can't I just eat my waffle? [ICON_HAPPY] xoxo
TEXT.German: Why can't I just eat my waffle? [ICON_HAPPY] xoxo
TEXT.Italian: Why can't I just eat my waffle? [ICON_HAPPY] xoxo
TEXT.Spanish: Why can't I just eat my waffle? [ICON_HAPPY] xoxo

TEXT.English: They say the caliber of a leader depends on what he is made of. My people came from the clouds, the very heavens above. What are you made of?
TEXT.French: They say the caliber of a leader depends on what he is made of. My people came from the clouds, the very heavens above. What are you made of?
TEXT.German: They say the caliber of a leader depends on what he is made of. My people came from the clouds, the very heavens above. What are you made of?

TEXT.Spanish: They say the caliber of a leader depends on what he is made of. My people came from the clouds, the very heavens above. What are you made of?

TEXT.English: Tremble before the almighty [OUR_NAME].
